message_1: Suppose you are using the Caesar Cipher with a shift of 3. Encode the message "HELLO" using a substitution cipher.
message_2:
To encode the message "HELLO" using a Caesar Cipher with a shift of 3, you will shift each letter in the message 3 positions forward in the alphabet. If a letter reaches the end of the alphabet, it will wrap around to the beginning. Here's the encoding process:

H -> K
E -> H
L -> O
L -> O
O -> R

The encoded message is "KHOOR".
